documents.title: Sameer:Nikita 1:1 - 2025/12/05 15:29 CET - Notes by Gemini
documents.content:
Ôªøüìù Notes

Dec 5, 2025

Sameer:Nikita 1:1

Invited Nikita Gorshkov Sameer Doda

Attachments Sameer:Nikita 1:1 

Meeting records Transcript 





Summary

Sameer Doda confirmed that the overall work volume is manageable, with Allison assisting on the platform and Good Chop Shopify projects, though Sameer Doda and Nikita Gorshkov noted that program revivals are unlikely due to a lack of resources, a point Sameer Doda, David, and Nikita Gorshkov discussed with Marina regarding unfunded work. Sameer Doda detailed their involvement in the complex Good Chop Shopify project, the DACH Juices support project for Nordic markets that requires a technical solution, and the Influencer Marketplace, which needs an MVP path forward due to varied stakeholder views and already has design progress with Shay; Sameer Doda and Nikita Gorshkov agreed on a simple one-time purchase customer journey for the MVP, but Sameer Doda raised concerns about limitations with applying vouchers and selling add-ons, which Nikita Gorshkov suggested discussing with Jama, and both acknowledged a need for more frontend development resources. Sameer Doda needs to coordinate with Jama for the roadmap review meeting and discussed the "Seamless Pricing Upgrade" initiative, which Nikita Gorshkov suggested de-prioritizing, while they also agreed to maintain two different views of the roadmap and implement an intake process with Ian as the tactical point of contact.





Details

Notes Length: Standard

* Overall Work Volume and Resource Allocation Sameer Doda confirmed that their overall volume of work is manageable, with Allison assisting on the platform and Good Chop Shopify projects. Sameer Doda and Nikita Gorshkov discussed that the revival of programs is unlikely soon due to a lack of available resources, unless it is fully funded, a decision that would need to come from Dominic (00:00:49) (00:04:03). Nikita Gorshkov noted that they, along with David, pushed back on Marina for introducing unfunded work that was taking up design capacity (00:03:05).

* Shopify Initiatives (Factor Form and Good Chop) Sameer Doda outlined their involvement in the Shopify projects, specifically Good Chop, which they anticipate will be more complex than Factor Form due to potential changes in the customer journey (00:00:49). The immediate next steps for the Good Chop project include developing a strategy document, creating a customer journey, and addressing edge cases such as account duplication and customer redirects, in addition to tactical work like third-party integrations (e.g., Recharge and Elevar) (00:02:10). Sameer Doda is confident that they can now manage the setup of Recharge if Allison is unavailable (00:03:05).

* DACH Juices Support Project Sameer Doda explained that Jama brought up a project to support launching juices in the Nordic markets, which Sameer Doda discussed with stakeholders and promised to provide timelines for in January (00:04:54). The required technical work involves automatically adding fan charges as a separate line item to the cart and to the auto summary when a juice pack is added, a task that is more complicated than it appears. Sameer Doda plans to create a requirements document after receiving answers to questions they posed to Viola (00:06:15).

* Influencer Marketplace Strategy and Customer Journey Sameer Doda has gone through all the research documents for the influencer marketplace and believes the initiative needs a proposed path forward for the MVP due to the variety of stakeholder views. They have created two separate customer journeys: one for customers buying as a one-time purchase box (former or paused customers) and another for active customers who might purchase an additional recipe (00:07:28). Nikita Gorshkov agreed with the focus on simplicity for the MVP, noting the very positive response from unstructured interviews and the potential for a viral moment, suggesting starting with three occasion boxes sold through influencers‚Äô channels to prove demand (00:08:50).

* Influencer Marketplace Design and Logistics Sameer Doda revealed that they are already making progress on the design, with Shay working on pages and profiles. The plan is to align on the basic one-time purchase customer journey, quickly show low-fidelity designs to senior stakeholders for feedback, and then have Shay continue with high-fidelity designs, reusing existing components from projects like the Christmas box flow (00:10:03). Sameer Doda and Nikita Gorshkov agreed that active customers should be able to buy even a small kit, like a dinner for two, as a one-time purchase, simplifying the front-end by avoiding the need to enforce minimum rules (00:12:03). Sameer Doda will set up a session the following week with Nikita Gorshkov and Shay to review the basic customer journey and low-fidelity designs (00:13:10).

* Influencer Marketplace Backend and Timeline Concerns Sameer Doda expressed concern that the ability to apply vouchers for one-time purchases is a limitation that may not be solved in time, an issue Nikita Gorshkov stated needs to be addressed with Jama. Other concerns include the current inability to sell add-ons on the one-time purchase flow (00:15:12). Sameer Doda noted a potential misalignment with the HelloFresh Canada physical product team, who may be planning for a Q2 launch, though Nikita Gorshkov indicated that Q2 is the latest agreed-upon deadline with Ian (00:17:54).

* Frontend Resource Needs Sameer Doda pointed out a need for more frontend development resources, as most of the current projects, including the influencer marketplace, the Benelix experiment, and the Duck juices support, involve significant frontend work (00:19:02). Nikita Gorshkov confirmed that they are looking to fill three open roles and that a frontend developer is needed to replace Deborah in addition to the existing team members (00:19:59).

* Upcoming Roadmap Review and Seamless Pricing Initiative Sameer Doda needs to coordinate with Jama on Monday to determine the invitees and process for the roadmap review meeting (00:22:19). They also discussed the "Seamless Pricing Upgrade" initiative, for which Sameer Doda lacks a clear problem statement beyond knowing there are general issues with seamless pricing (00:23:15). Nikita Gorshkov located the item in the initiatives log, which refers to encouraging upgrades and flexibility on smaller sizes, but noted that the comment dates it to Q3, allowing them to de-prioritize it for now (00:24:48).

* Roadmap Visualization and Intake Process Sameer Doda shared an alternative, more visual road map view that they prefer for presentation, which they agreed to continue maintaining alongside Nikita Gorshkov's preferred view that splits work streams into different "swim lanes" for better visibility of design, product, and engineering discovery allocation (00:26:07). Sameer Doda also introduced an intake sheet to manage new requests, though they need to define to whom it will be evangelized. Nikita Gorshkov proposed a structure where Ian serves as the tactical point of contact to minimize interactions with senior leaders like Ed, with road map reviews happening monthly for visibility (00:29:54).





Suggested next steps

* Sameer Doda will set up a session next week with the physical product team for HelloFresh Canada to align on the Q1 target date for the influencer marketplace.

* Sameer Doda will go through the answers received from Viola regarding the duck juices support and create a requirements document, including an estimate for when the work will be picked up in Q1.

* Sameer Doda will set up a session next week with Nikita Gorshkov and Shay to (1) review the basic customer journey for the onetime purchase flow and the low fidelity designs for the influencer marketplace, and (2) work with Shay to iron out changes needed on the low fidelity designs so Shay can continue working on the high fidelity designs.

* Sameer Doda and Nikita Gorshkov will connect with Jamba on Monday to discuss the roadmap review meeting with stakeholders and determine the invitees.





You should review Gemini's notes to make sure they're accurate. Get tips and learn how Gemini takes notes

Please provide feedback about using Gemini to take notes in a short survey.

On-track from dev pov

Captures business value earlier (~$15k in revenue)





	Super risky as most devs are out (Jordon, Jan, Edwin, Emily, Daniel, Travis)

Super close to EOY

Not enough time for gradual rollout

	Launch W51 

(To only 10%)

	Mitigates the risk

(To 90% of users)

________________









Oct 31, 2025 | Hamed/Nikita 1:1 

Attendees: Nikita Gorshkov Hamed Karimian

Attached files: Roadmap - Factor Form 





Notes

   * Nice and structured AHM, the new org makes a ton of sen



ckable only ‚Äî no code).





Recruit 10‚Äì15 representative users (existing customers or target personas).





Ask them to choose between:





Current ‚Äúbuild-your-own‚Äù flow





The new ‚Äúplan-based‚Äù flow





Ask follow-ups:





Which feels more tailored to you?





Which would you trust more?





How likely are you to purchase?





‚úÖ Advantages: Fast qualitative signal; surfaces objections early.

üí° Tip: Use Figma Analytics or Maze metrics (time on screen, clicks) for light quant data.





Option 3: ‚ÄúFake Door‚Äù Test in Live Site





Goal: Measure real interest from actual users without building full functionality.





On your live PLP or homepage, add a new section or banner:





‚ÄúIntroducing our new lifestyle plans ‚Äî Performance, Focus, and Foundation.‚Äù

CTA: ‚ÄúExplore Plans.‚Äù





When users click, send them to a ‚ÄúComing Soon‚Äù page or a short survey:





‚ÄúWe‚Äôre launching soon ‚Äî tell us which plan interests you most.‚Äù





Measure clicks, plan preference, and sign-ups for early access.





‚úÖ Advantages: True behavioral data from live traffic.

üí° Tip: Works well if your current site already gets meaningful volume.





Option 4: Email or CRM Campaign Test





Goal: Validate resonance of messaging and pricing.





Segment your customer base (athletes, busy professionals, general wellness).





Send A/B email variants ‚Äî one promoting current product set, one promoting ‚Äúplans.‚Äù





Measure CTR, click-to-checkout, or pre-order intent.





‚úÖ Advantages: Zero dev time, quick pulse check on messaging effectiveness.





üìä How to Evaluate Results

Metric        Signal        Success Criteria

CTR / engagement        Do users click into plan-based offers more than product-based ones?        +15‚Äì20% vs. baseline

Intent (survey or fake door)        Are users more likely to say they‚Äôd subscribe?        Majority (>60%) positive

AOV (simulated)        When choosing a plan, is average intended spend higher?        +10‚Äì15% lift

Qualitative sentiment        Do users say the plan feels easier, more relevant, or trustworthy?        Positive pattern emerges





If 2‚Äì3 of these indicators trend positively, that‚Äôs a green light to justify design + dev investment for a live experiment.





üöÄ Recommended Next Step (Low-Effort, High-Insight)





Build a simple Figma prototype with your three plans + ‚ÄúChoose Plan‚Äù CTA, and test it via qualitative plan. (Option 2)
